Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, fabric is grey-black in section, interior covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, exterior covered with a red-brown slip, which has flaked away in places, with faint traces of at least ten lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a portion of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.91)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87594) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87594)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 95 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
